column4: I cannot believe that 9.10 -> 10.04 upgrade destroyed my RAID1... if that really is the case I'd say that's a _serious_ flaw
unless you've deliberately written to the disks involved in the RAID, they should still be intact. try recreating the array.
only thing I've done manually is mdadm --assemble --scan as the raid was not working when I booted up using this live CD
with what result?
I got md0, but with empy partition table
these disks are separate from the disk on which you've installed ubuntu?
before the mdadm I tried using this GUI disk utility but it said it cannot start the array as some parts was missing
no, md0 is mounted as /
which disk utility?
system->administration->disk utility
could you pastebin the output of mdadm --query?
mdadm --assemble --scan won't work, because it relies on having a raid configuration file in /etc, which was probably overwritten in the upgrade.
well, strike that last bit, that seems unlikely, on further consideration.
mdadm --query only says "no devices given"...mdadm --query /dev/md0 says /dev/md0: 144.39GiB raid1 2 devices, 0 spares. Use mdadm --detail for more detail.
and --detail?
this is my first time in IRC don't know what pastebin is :)
pasted
i'll need the link :-)
http://paste.ubuntu.com/476958/
looks fine to me. and when you mount it?
wth? now it mounted?
like magic!
o.O
this is so very strange I cannot understand this... now I must try reinstalling grub according to the instructions... I hope the computer boots then. thanks for the magic :D
